title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 August 2015 - XWiki
content:
<cjd> has joined #xwiki  
02:44 <cjd> has quit  
04:26 <cpe> has quit  
04:27 <cpe> has joined #xwiki

05:15 <sorinello> has quit  
05:18 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki

05:18 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki

07:54 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki

09:05 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki

09:14 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <Pbas> has quit  
09:54 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:42 <evalica> has quit  
11:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:23 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:33 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <Slashman> hello, is it possible to rollback to an older release? in my case, from 7.1.1 to 7.0.1?  
12:18 <tmortagne1> Slashman: it depends what you saved and/or what you modified already, to put back a fully upgraded version of XWiki you need previous database and previous permanent dir  
12:19 <tmortagne1> database because it's possible there has been modifications in the shema or in some classes (I don't really remember exactly for 7.0.1 vs 7.1.1) and the permanent dir because that where installed extensions are registered  
12:22 <Slashman> tmortagne1: okay, I guess a full rollback is the only safe way...  
12:23 <Slashman> tmortagne1: I'm pretty desperate about the issues in XWIKI-12406, do you see any way that it can be solved?  
12:24 <Slashman> tmortagne1: we basically can't modify anything in xwiki now  
12:24 <tmortagne1> even when it's not root ?  
12:25 <Slashman> tmortagne1: yeah, the issue persists  
12:25 <tmortagne1> has quit  
12:25 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:25 <Slashman> tmortagne1: every attachment end in the undefined page  
12:25 <tmortagne> any idea what you did ?  
12:26 <tmortagne> ok so moving to root and going back to /xwiki killed it ?  
12:26 <Slashman> I guess so  
12:27 <tmortagne> didn't reinstall fixed it for you last time ?  
12:27 <Slashman> well, the problem is basically the same when the context is ROOT or xwiki  
12:27 <tmortagne> (I mean fixed the /xwiki/ mode)  
12:27 <Slashman> I'll try to reinstall again  
12:28 <Chuguniy> has quit  
12:28 <Slashman> is there any way that the database was corrupted?  
12:29 <tmortagne> no idea since  don't really know exactly what would have caused the issue you have (stuck on LDAP issues today...)  
12:31 <Slashman> reinstall solved it for now, I have no clue what happened  
12:42 <tmortagne> Slashman: at least that means it's not a database thing but it's weird  
12:42 <tmortagne> are you sure you don't forget something when you put back in /xwiki/ mode .  
12:42 <tmortagne> ?  
12:50 <Slashman> not sure... I only modify the /etc/tomcat7/Catalina/localhost/xwiki.xml file  
12:50 <Slashman> the only things I played with is the httpd configuration to reverse proxy it  
12:52 <Slashman> I tried to remove the context with httpd url rewrite but it didn't work, now I have the context all the time, maybe something broke during my reverse proxy test  
13:16 <cjd> has quit  
13:49 <Ramona1> has quit  
13:49 <Ramona3> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <cpe> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <msmeria> has quit  
15:02 <cpe\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <Ramona3> has quit  
15:02 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:05 <cpe> has quit  
15:05 <cpe\_> is now known as <cpe>  
15:09 <Trefex> hey guys, ClemensR, tmortagne, and so on :)  
15:09 <Trefex> Which permission does a group need so that one can "create a new page"  
15:09 <Trefex> right now i think my group has View, Comment, Edit and Register, but no Add button is available  
15:09 <tmortagne> just edit at the space level where you want to create that document AFAIK  
15:09 <ClemensR> edit should be sufficient  
15:10 <cpe> has quit  
15:10 <ClemensR> where exactly does not not have the add button, I mean in which space?  
15:10 <Trefex> in the sub-wiki space  
15:11 <tmortagne> does your group has edit right on the current document ? maybe the check is on current document instead of current space which would be a bug  
15:11 <ClemensR> the WikiMananger space ?  
15:11 <Trefex> ah something is wrong i think  
15:11 <Trefex> i mapped the group to an LDAP group  
15:11 <Trefex> am i correct to assume that this should give me access to the sub-wiki, if i defined groups rights in that sub.wiki ?  
15:11 <cpe> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <Trefex> or does a user still have to register ?  
15:12 <tmortagne> you can check if your user is in the expected group  
15:13 <tmortagne> and yes a user has to login for the membership to make updated  
15:13 <tmortagne> but I don't understand how you can test if you are not logged in  
15:13 <ClemensR> well, but no need to register for the subwiki  
15:13 <ClemensR> so the user is in the main wiki, but the group is in the subwiki ?  
15:14 <Trefex> ClemensR gets what i mean :)  
15:14 <tmortagne> ha you are talking about wiki module stuff  
15:14 <tmortagne> all that does is adding the user is XWikiAllGroup of the subwiki  
15:14 <Trefex> ClemensR: yeah the group is a global group, and in the subwiki i gave that global group view, comment and edit  
15:14 <tmortagne> but you don't care about that if you explicitely set the rights you need  
15:15 <ClemensR> ist it possible  that you gave the right to a local group with the same name?  
15:15 <Trefex> it seems the user is not added automatically to that group  
15:15 <Trefex> maybe ldap groups cache ?  
15:15 <ClemensR> does "global group" mean "group  the main wiki" or "group in the subwiki" ?  
15:16 <Trefex> ClemensR: it's a group in the main wiki  
15:16 <Trefex> so when i am in the subwiki, i have to click on "Global" to see it  
15:16 <ClemensR> ok, and the user is not in that group, if you check in the main wiki ?  
15:16 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:16 <tmortagne> Trefex: what version of XWiki is this and you logged in subwiki or main wiki ?  
15:16 <ClemensR> but the user is member of the LDAP group ?  
15:17 <Trefex> tmortagne: 7.1.2 and i logged in main wiki, as i can't see the subwiki  
15:17 <Trefex> ClemensR: yes  
15:17 <tmortagne> if you want to make sure users are authenticated on main wiki wherever you authenticate look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/LDAPAuthenticationUseCases#HI27minamultiwikienvironmentandIwantmyLDAPuserstoregisteronlyonthemainwiki  
15:18 <tmortagne> otherwise the your user will be added to the subwiki group listed in your configuration  
15:18 <tmortagne> and the user will be created i the subwiki which is probably not what you want anyway  
15:18 <ClemensR> can you try to login to the sub wiki directly with that user? even though the wiki is not listed  
15:19 <Ramona1> has quit  
15:19 <tmortagne> if you login on main wiki and your user is still not in the expected mapped group then I guess you will have enable debug log for LDAP  
15:20 <tmortagne> ( http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HEnableLDAPdebuglog )  
15:21 <Trefex> one sec  
15:26 <Trefex> at this point, we don't have LDAP enabled on the sub-wikis  
15:26 <Trefex> i mean the application  
15:26 <Trefex> so i don't have that problem tmortagne  
15:26 <Trefex> ClemensR: i'll try to login directly to the sub-wiki  
15:27 <Trefex> You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action  
15:27 <tmortagne> Trefex: well if you don't have LDAP then you issue is simply that you did not adde the user in the group then  
15:27 <Trefex> but the group mapping should be automatic no?  
15:28 <Trefex> tmortagne: here is a screencap from the LDAP config of the main wiki  
15:28 <Trefex> http://i.imgur.com/pRAiQww.png  
15:28 <tmortagne> I don't understand, if you don't have LDAP then LDAP is not going to apply the mapping  
15:29 <Trefex> LDAP is in the main wiki  
15:29 <tmortagne> ok then  
15:29 <Trefex> not in the subs  
15:29 <tmortagne> anyway as you said you logged in on main wiki so that was no the issue  
15:29 <tmortagne> you should enabled debug log and see what you get  
15:30 <Trefex> on which module? com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.ldap or LDAPAuthServiceImpl  
15:31 <tmortagne> everything listed in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HEnableLDAPdebuglog  
15:31 <Trefex> i never find any doc when i search, and you guys paste stuff like it's christman  
15:31 <Trefex> christmas\*  
15:32 <tmortagne> easy when you write it :)  
15:32 <tmortagne> !find LDAP  
15:32 <tmortagne> don't remember IRC command  
15:32 <Trefex> and the log is the tomcat log?  
15:33 <tmortagne> !search LDAP  
15:33 <tmortagne> yea not great result in this case  
15:34 <tmortagne> the log is standard log so catalina.out by default yes  
15:34 <Trefex> paff NullPointerException  
15:34 <Trefex> beautiful  
15:35 <tmortagne> NullPointerException may be more a consequence than a cause  
15:35 <Trefex> obviously nobody told me that the LDAP group on the GUI should a LDAP DN, and not just the group name...  
15:35 <tmortagne> could you paste your log in pastebing or something  
15:36 <tmortagne> actually it's not only DN  
15:36 <Trefex> http://paste.ubuntu.com/12124786/  
15:37 <tmortagne> but yes better put DN in the mapping  
15:37 <tmortagne> (it also support filter or organization unit)  
15:37 <Trefex> tmortagne: so according to the log my group name is not what he expects  
15:37 <tmortagne> yep  
15:38 <tmortagne> you should put DN  
15:38 <tmortagne> id is supported only as group member (since some LDAP groups contains id instead of DNs)  
15:38 <Trefex> is that documented somehwere?  
15:38 <tmortagne> xwiki.cfg  
15:38 <tmortagne> and http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication which is a copy of xwiki.cfg  
15:39 <Trefex> which i don't use since i use the GUI :D  
15:39 <tmortagne> yep the GUI does not give much information  
15:39 <Trefex> i see that now  
15:39 <Trefex> yep xwiki seems to have some doc that would have helped me  
15:39 <Trefex> hahaha  
15:39 <Trefex> -.-  
15:40 <tmortagne> but it's supposed to do to request and stuff to help (never really used it myself)  
15:40 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:41 <tmortagne> you can use the id in a filter if you want  
15:41 <tmortagne> but really you should use the complete DN at least for performances reason  
15:41 <tmortagne> it won't need to search for it  
15:41 <Trefex> tmortagne: Adding user [XWiki.test] to xwiki group [xWikiBioCore]  
15:41 <Trefex> progress!  
15:42 <Trefex> tmortagne: what's the difference between https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/xWikiBioCore and https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/bin/view/Main/xWikiBioCore ?  
15:43 <Trefex> because now i have two groups with the same name  
15:43 <tmortagne> two completely different pages  
15:43 <tmortagne> groups are supposed to go in XWiki space  
15:43 <tmortagne> but you indicated xWikiBioCore which it should be the complete name  
15:43 <tmortagne> XWiki.xWikiBioCore ?  
15:43 <Trefex> aye caramba  
15:44 <tmortagne> xWikiBioCore ended up resolved as Main.xWikiBioCore because Main is s the default space  
15:44 <Trefex> ah ok, don't get yet fully how the xWiki system works :(  
15:45 <Trefex> ah when it works, it's beautiful !  
15:46 <tmortagne> the UI should help and constraint more but need someone to work on it...  
15:46 <Trefex> tell me Thomas, where can I tip you ? :)  
15:46 <Trefex> i've been bugging you since 5 months!  
15:48 <tmortagne> aha, best tip are contributions ;)  
15:49 <Trefex> ahah, you want me as a contributor? except submitting bugs and annoying you, what am i good for?  
15:50 <tmortagne> finding bugs is already contributing, there is lots of things listed on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing that don't require coding skills like adding stuff on xwiki.org, answering question from others, translations, etc.  
15:54 <mflorea> has quit  
16:15 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:18 <Trefex> tmortagne: i have a last question for today, what is the best scripting option in xWiki and is there any doc on that?  
16:18 <Trefex> i tried some stuff yesterday in Velocity, but it was an epic fail  
16:19 <tmortagne> Velocity is more templating that scripting, you have a bit of logic in it but it's more designed to generate UI, best advanced scripting option would be Groovy I think  
16:19 <tmortagne> the limitation with Groovy is that it require programming right  
16:19 <OSIMasson> has quit  
16:19 <Trefex> for instance, i wanted to generate a list of wikis and sort them alphabetically and make them links  
16:20 <Trefex> in velocity i could juste print the wikis, but sorting, pfff no way  
16:20 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <tmortagne> well for this use the sirting would not be done by Velocity by by standard Java APIs  
16:21 <Trefex> yeah i tried using $sorttool or what not  
16:23 <tmortagne> I think I would try to put this use case in Velocity myself but since we constraint ourself to do only Velocity in standard XE that would probably be more a reflex  
16:23 <tmortagne> anyway if you have PR and you are sure nobody will break your pages then don't hesitate to use Groovy  
16:24 <tmortagne> it's a real language and performances are better than Velocity  
16:25 <tmortagne> the python or ruby macros works well too but python Java implementation is way slower and I don't have much experience with ruby (which is not included by default)  
16:26 <Trefex> ok we will investigate this a bit  
16:26 <Trefex> only Admins have PR  
16:26 <Trefex> we would just need a way to prevent people to edit pages that have code in them  
16:26 <tmortagne> actually even admin may not have PR  
16:26 <Trefex> possibly via a seperate space?  
16:26 <Trefex> in our config, they do ;)  
16:27 <tmortagne> you can simply setup your pages with PR script to not be editable by anyone else than admins  
16:27 <tmortagne> or put all of them in a specific space protected like the XWiki space is  
16:28 <ClemensR> yep, and then include them where needed  
16:29 <ClemensR> there are quite a few groovy code snippet examples on e.x.o:  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#|t=extensions&p=1&l=30&s=doc.creationDate&d=desc&type=snippet  
16:30 <Trefex> how do you set permissions for a single page?  
16:31 <tmortagne> you need to be advanced user (in your profile) and then you get a menu when over Edit button in which you can edit rights  
16:31 <ClemensR> edit button -> access rights ?  
16:31 <Trefex> omg lol  
16:31 <Trefex> sorry i'm becoming more stupid as time advances  
16:33 <ClemensR> some more random links:  sorting lists  using your own comparators in groovy:  http://groovy-lang.org/groovy-dev-kit.html#\_sorting  
16:34 <ClemensR> want sorting done in groovy, but rendering in velocity?  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting#HSharevariablebetweenlanguages  
16:35 <ClemensR> ok, now me should really go back and debug my nasty little local problem here instead ;)  
16:35 <Trefex> ClemensR: yeah botha re fine with me  
16:35 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:44 <Trefex> is there a way to rename a document ?  
16:45 <Trefex> ClemensR:  
16:46 <ClemensR> Trefex: yes ;)  
16:47 <Trefex> not the title, i mean the actual document name  
16:47 <ClemensR> $xwiki.renameDocument( $doc, $newName)  - see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/SRD/Navigation?xpage=embed  
16:48 <ClemensR> same in groovy, just leave out the '$' :)  
16:55 <Trefex> ClemensR: mhhh wiki.renameDocument(doc, 'toto') doesn't work  
16:55 <Trefex> i'm sure i missed something :D  
16:58 <ClemensR> migth depend in what "doc" is - how to you get that one? can you check with println doc.isNew(); if you got the expected document and not a non-existing one?  
16:58 <ClemensR> also maybe "toto" -> "Space.toto"  
16:59 <Trefex> doc.isNew() => false  
16:59 <Trefex> well right now i do it in the document i want to rename, and simply do doc.getDocument() before i just tried doc  
17:01 <Trefex> ClemensR: also, while i didn't get the groovy to work, there's a button to do it, when you're on the page  
17:01 <Trefex> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/DocumentLifecycle#HMove2FRename  
17:03 <ClemensR> yes, of course one can do it in the UI,  I just tougth you need to do it programatically  
17:03 <Trefex> ClemensR: both  
17:03 <ClemensR> and using "doc" in a script is a stupid habit of mine  
17:04 <Trefex> ClemensR: is it not good ?  
17:04 <ClemensR> it conflicts with the predefined variable of "the current document"; better define a new one like :   docToMove = xwiki.getDocument("Space.PageName")  
17:05 <Trefex> ah gotcha  
17:05 <ClemensR> well, you probably do not want to move around the page in which the script is located itself  
17:05 <Trefex> from the doc, it seems $doc.rename("space.toto") would be the way to rename  
17:05 <ClemensR> everytime you view the page it moves to a new location, that would be fun  
17:06 <ClemensR> ah, yes, I forgot about that option  
17:06 <Trefex> that platform link you sent is worth gold  
17:06 <Trefex> thanks for that :)  
17:08 <ClemensR> I never need to bookmark the SRD page, because it is always in my browser history :)  
17:08 <ClemensR> it is linked in the developer documentation somewhere, however  
17:09 <Trefex> truth, most useful thing we were still missing  
17:09 <Trefex> i think i finally feel comfortable to roll it out in production :)  
17:09 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:10 <ClemensR> ok, good :)  
17:25 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
17:36 <Trefex> has quit
